summary: This bill, the Competition and Antitrust Law Enforcement Reform Act of 2025, aims to strengthen antitrust laws to protect competition in the American economy. It focuses on reforming merger standards, deterring anticompetitive conduct, and enhancing the enforcement capabilities of the Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission. Key provisions include defining market power, modifying the Clayton Act, establishing new offices and studies, protecting whistleblowers, and increasing penalties. The bill also prohibits forced arbitration in antitrust disputes and authorizes appropriations for enforcement.
